Expectation1: Support each other emotionally during tough times
Situation1: One sibling has just received some very difficult news and is deeply distressed by it.
Expectation2: Secure packages and confirm successful delivery
Situation2: Leaving a package safely at the doorstep when no one is home
Story: My phone buzzed just as I was pulling up to the next house on my delivery route. It was my sister, her voice trembling, barely holding back tears. She’d just gotten some terrible news—her job was gone, and she didn’t know what to do. I could hear the panic in her voice, and every instinct in me screamed to drop everything and be there for her, to listen, to comfort her like I always had. But as I listened, I glanced at the package in my passenger seat, the address matching the house in front of me. The instructions were clear: leave the package only if someone was home, otherwise, take it back to the depot. No one answered the door, and I knew if I didn’t follow protocol, I could get in trouble at work. My heart pounded as I tried to split my attention, torn between my sister’s pain and my responsibility to my job. I gripped the steering wheel, feeling the weight of both worlds pressing down on me, unsure which one I could let down.
